title: Inscanner: Dual-Phased Detection and Classification of Auxiliary Insulation Using YOLOv8 Models
author: Youngtae Kim (Doaz Corporation), Soonju Jeong (Doaz Corporation), Sardar Arslan (Doaz Corporation), Dhananjay Agnihotri (Lotte E&C), Yahya Ahmed (Lotte E&C), Ali Nawaz (Lotte E&C), Jinhee Song (Lotte E&C), Hyewon Kim (Lotte E&C), ..., Ali Nawaz (Doaz Corporation)
relevance_why: The proposed two-phase deep learning pipeline for insulation detection and classification could inspire methods for audio categorization and defect detection in audio signals, especially integrating computer vision techniques with audio analysis.
background: Detecting and classifying insulation in structural blueprints through a two-phase model using deep learning techniques.
contribution: This paper introduces a novel two-phase framework combining YOLOv8 for detection and YOLOv8-CLS for classification to automate insulation verification, achieving an mAP score of 82% and an accuracy of 98%.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing methods often rely on traditional machine learning techniques and do not effectively handle the high variability and complexity found in insulation patterns.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work uses state-of-the-art YOLO models, significantly enhancing the speed and accuracy of defect detection in large-scale blueprints compared to earlier methods.

key_innovation: The integration of object detection and classification phases allows for a more efficient processing workflow tailored for complex industrial insulation tasks.
real_world_impact: Promotes greater efficiency in industrial quality assurance processes by automating labor-intensive inspection tasks, potentially reducing human error and inspection times.

new_terms.mean Average Precision: **Mean Average Precision (mAP)** is a widely used metric for evaluating object detection models, measuring the accuracy of detected objects by accounting for both precision and recall across multiple classes.
